title: admin - export this owncloud instance
body:
i tried to "backup" my owncloud instance thinking i'd get my files, contacts, calendar, tasks, and bookmarks.  i tried each of the following, and used the result to "restore" to a separate development machine.

* owncloud instance (user data and database)
* owncloud system files
* just user files

none of these options appear to backup all data for all users of owncloud.

unzipping the result file into my development machine owncloud data directory restored user accounts, and user files.  things not restored were contacts, calendar, tasks, and bookmarks.

what i had hoped, and expected to happen is all user data for all users be backed up by 'instance' or 'just user files'.  i also hoped to find an "admin import" or equivalent to restore all users and their data.  so a restore operation would amount to install owncloud 5.0.10, then perform an admin import to restore the whole setup, independent of using mysql or sqlite3 backends.  in real life as an "admin" i might also need to restore only an individual user and/or individual user app (calendar, contacts, ...)

is this backup/restore (export/import) feature broken or missing?

i would like to do this operation as an owncloud admin independent of which database backend is being used.

my primary server is running owncloud 5.0.10, as is my development machine.  my primary server is using a mysql backend.  my development machine is using the built in sqlite3 5.0.17 db.
